title: Exotic Solutions in Einstein-Antisymmetric Tensor Theory
abstract: Classical solutions of the self-interacting, non-abelian antisymmetric tensor gauge theory of Freedman and Townsend coupled to Einstein gravity is discussed. Particularly, it is demonstrated that the theory admits a classical metric solution which, depending on the value of the gauge coupling parameter of the theory, exhibits a black hole with an exotic non-abelian hair or a spacetime showing the ``violation of the cosmic censorship hypothesis'' which should be distinguished from white holes.
